Children of the 80s
How Many Can You Bold?
1. You've ever ended a sentence with the word "PSYCH!"
2. You watched the Pound Puppies.
3. You can sing the rap to the "Fresh Prince of Bel Air."
4. You wore biker shorts under your skirts and felt stylish.
5. You yearned to be a member of the Baby-Sitters Club and tried to start a club of your own.
6. You owned those little Strawberry Shortcake pals scented dolls.
7. You know that "WOAH" comes from Joey on Blossom.
8. Two words: M.C. Hammer.
9. If you ever watched "Fraggle Rock."
10. You had plastic streamers on your handle bars.
11. You can sing the entire theme song to "Duck Tales."
12. You remember when it was actually worth getting up early on a Saturday to watch cartoons.
13. You wore a ponytail on the side of your head.
14. You saw the original "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" on the big screen.
15. You got super-excited when it was Oregon Trail day in computer class at school.
16. You made your Mom buy one of those clips that would hold your shirt in a knot on the side.
17. You played the game "MASH" (Mansion, Apartment, Shelter Shack, House).
18. You wore a Jordache Jean jacket and you were proud of it.
19. L.A. Gear
20. You wanted to change your name to "JEM" in Kindergarten.
21. You remember reading Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing and all the Ramona books.
22. You know the profound meaning of "WAX ON, WAX OFF."
23. You wanted to be a Goonie.
24. You ever wore fluorescent clothing.
25. You can remember what Michael Jackson looked like before his nose fell off.
26. You have pondered why Smurfette was the only female smurf.
27. You took lunch pails to school.
28. You remember the CRAZE, then the BANNING of slap bracelets.
29. You still get the urge to say "NOT" after every sentence.
30. You remember Hypercolor T-shirts.
31. Barbie and the Rockers was your favorite band.
32. You thought She-Ra and He-Man should hook up.(i never understood how no one figured out that the prince was he-man!)
33. You thought your childhood friends would never leave because you exchanged friendship bracelets.
34. You ever owned a pair of jelly shoes.
35. After you saw Pee-Wee's Big Adventure you kept saying "I know what you are, but what am I?"
36.You remember "I've fallen and I can't get up!"
37. You remember going to the skating rink before there were inline skates.
38. You ever got seriously injured on a Slip'n'Slide.
39. You have ever played with a Skip-It.
40. You had or attended a birthday party at McDonald's.
41. You've gone through this list occasionally saying "totally awesome."
42. You remember Popples.
43. "Don't worry, be happy."
44. You wore like, EIGHT pairs of socks over tights with high top Reeboks.
45. You wore socks scrunched down.
46. "Miss MARY MACK MACK MACK, all dressed in BLACK BLACK BLACK" (on the bus to the game...)
47. You remember boom boxes vs. CD players.
48. You remember watching both "Gremlins" movies.
49. You know what it meant to say "Care Bear Stare!"
50. You remember watching Rainbow Brite and My Little Ponies.
51. You thought Doogie Howser was hot.
52. You remember Alf, the lil furry brown alien from Melmac.
53. You remember New Kids on the Block when they were cool.
54. You knew all the characters names and their life stories on "Saved By the Bell."
55. You know all the words to Bon Jovi.

i may or may not be at school tomorrow considering i may have to evacuate my house. the fire is about a mile away and they are evacuating the houses above me...so this is excellent.

anyway, i bought my rat today. he is the cutest thing ever. he is gray and brown and will be a large rat but for now he is a baby. all i now about him is that he likes bocelli music (he grinds his teeth when i play it...a good sign) and he likes broccoli. other than that, his first major experience with his new family will probably be a 2 hour ride to escondido because we have to evacuate.

anyway, i hope the fire ceases to spread, but who knows? i really dont want to miss the toy test, but it seems i may not have much choice in the matter.

i am a bit disgruntled, because some people seem to have misconstrued my situation in france. I do not feel that i did anything wrong, but who knows? if people think im weak or pathetic or too hasty in coming back, they can go spend 2 weeks with the dumays and prove themselves right. 

ok, so here are the things i am looking forward to.

-seeing everyone.
-the seemingly endless list of exciting events approaching.
-school (first time in forever)
-my life.

things im not looking forward to
-explaining myself to people. three words- it was bad.
-make up work , j'ai beacoup de travaille pour rattraper, as they say in french.
-mr.toy

even though i am so thankful that i am home, i still feel awkward about the whole exchange student thing. my family and i know perfectly well that i did the right thing in returning, but i really do not want people hassling me about returning, and saying 
"you didn't give it very long" etc. thank god i didn't give it very long.

i just want everyone to understand, and that is very unlikely.

1. nabokov is amazing, and pale fire is the funniest book i've ever read.
2. INTERNATIONAL TALK LIKE A PIRATE DAY- september 19

3. see you all in 1.5 weeks.

byee

two things i have learned...
exchange programs are only for people who have very little to leave behind and miss
also, you really don't know what you've got til it's gone.

so, my classes are not sufficient to complete "11th" grade, and so this is a problem. also, i trust my judgement and i know that being here is not for me. i tried to be nice to everyone, work hard 5(the farm is awesome), but i know that two girls do not like me because i hang around them too much...need i say NO SHIT SHERLOCK? hello!!i do not speak perfect french nor do i have any idea what is ever going on, because they often forget to tell me.

in conclusion, i am not sorry i came here. in such a short time i learned a lifetime of things... but, it is not for me, not for someone who loves their friends so much, or more importantly, not for someone who won't allow people to comme on dit, se blesse se blesse se blesse because the person is not the me as them.

at first, i was hesitant to come back, because i thought i would feel weak, but in reality, it is a harder decision to make to come back, than it is to leave.

so, after all, france is still wonderful, but living with some people who would abandon as quickly me in montmartre as they would except a million dollar check, is not wonderful. 

apparently; the other exchange students had no friends at home to miss; quelle surprise?????

what do you guys think, if you came to france and hated life, and knew that it could only worsen, would you leave? knowing also that upon return to cali a year later your future would nearly be screwed beyond repair??(failed to tell me this...)

think whatever you want, but i am doing what i think is best for myself, my education, and my parents.

with hope,
chan the man

p.s. i dont know if i will be going to no ho, but it does not matter, as long as i am back.

washington, washington, washington dc. i cannot describe everything that happened at nslc, that would take forever, but i can say that i had an excellent time. i represented cameroon in the palestine/israel security council, and my fellow cameroonians were definitely a major factor in enjoying my time there. i am going to develop my pictures, and maybe figure out how to post them. i always have difficulty recounting trips or experiences that span more than a day or so, but here is a brief run-down of some people i met. jason my t.a.- ass-grabber, but overall excellent man. his first impression of me was that i was "sassy" and needed to smile more ( sassy meaning bitchy). but then, we parted on very good terms, and i love him. ryan- from chicago...all i can say is that he was perfect. grr. sara- my love, haha. we spoke french all the time together, and without her i would have died. we had the best time, and i am going to miss her an unreasonable amount. marcus- the funniest man alive ( besides frosty). he looks so goofy, and at first he acted like david updegrove, because he goes to an all boys school and does not know how to socialize with girls, but then he got used to us, and proved to not only be incredibly smart ( we had an hour long convo about donne,blake and wordsworth) but also sweet and hilarious. wanchi- really cute, a little apprehensive when it comes to being herself, but overall a great person. she was the first person i befriended so i love her. stefan- my republican brother from another mother. he was so awesome, what more can i say, we owned our security council. there were many others, but those were who i was closest with, i know my account is very brief and lame, but oh well. so many stories...so little time... luv, chan degs i wish you would have been there. core- ryan is from chicago and says "hyat" not hot.

im in washington and it is damn hot!!!! and humid. so heres the lowdown I metsome awesome people, like this chic wanchi, and this other girl suzy, but my roommates suck!! anyway, im about to go to an orientation, so i thought id check in, basically, it is way too hot and way too large of a campus ( though it is about a quarter of stanford...this heat makes it expand(literally)) im so magnet. oh well, i should prob go to this orientation, i look like ass but thats all good, everyone else does too... bnsalfdws;lgh;erg fhqwgads chan

succeeding a relatively eventful day, today was exceptionally mediocre without a trace of daftness to
entertain me.
kaitlin plat and i were going to go somewhere after school but she could not contact her dad in time
and therefore i was left with two options : walk to starbucks by myself and hang out there or go to my stepdad's work and be bored out of my mind, but have a computer... i chose the latter and what a mistake it has been. the only productive thing i have managed to do is dig up richard's resume from this computer. 
i have not relinquished my annoyance with mr.toy yet, though today he was much nicer...that man can suck it.
also, my french class has once again reverted to slandering me because i get better grades than they do on tests..i am sorry, what do you want me to do, progressively and purposely do worse on tests? blow me! 
a certain person was driving me crazy today because they would not cease to complain about a b, i was about to lay the smack down on him/her, but i was in a good mood.
do you know there are a lot of lj communities about murder? i was curious to see who included tvc15 on their interests list and one person had murder in their list which was bold so i clicked it and a wealth of listings appeared... future serial killers unite! anyway...
those of who you have seen vg and have suggestions about what items/accessories are appropriate for a themed party about this please give me ideas, i have drawn a blank on what i should get...
what else, what else? oh, on the topic of israel and palestine, it annoys me how people do not look at both sides when adopting an opinion about the matter, it is always so biased and that won't change but it does not nullify the obnoxiousness of it.
ok i should go before i write 10 pages, bye

chan

i am not sure why i am updating. house of 1000 corpses: 6.9/10- it was not gory enough, but i really liked the way it was done, it was very rob zombie-esque. but still not gory enough. it was hilarious though, on purpose, this one guy is so funny/frightening/awesome. "they do it over there, but we don't do it here...fashion, turn to the left, turn to the right, ohh fashion, we are the goonsquad and we're coming to town..." i plan on going to krav today, and i have no idea when i am going to do all of my homework this weekend. i have no time for the history study guide/satire... it is early...8h25, i want this shirt!!! i hope to see some of you at andrews party tonight... my soccer team is retarded, except for lara, katherine, jaimie and a few others, they cannot follow directions, it makes me so annoyed. i play center defense and i am supposed to tell them what to do, and i literally have to wave my arms over my head and scream in their ears if i want them to even try to do something. how difficult is it to return to your positions when the other team has the ball? geez. anyway. i should go and start some kind of homework. no quiero hacer mi tareja. richard had an argument in spanish about a blakc cat yesterday, we didn't even know what we were tlaking about but thats ok. anyway, i gtg eli is awake... loser.... jk chan

the most pleasant dream i have had in a long while:
i was on a boat, which took me forever to get to for the sand kept melting away while the waves swallowed up my raft. finally after much difficulty reaching the ship, i and several others boarded it. it was there that we were told to be "counselors" to the children on the boat. with no disagreement about our new found responsibility we basically neglected the children and went to a party that was being held beneath us. and so we went, (here is where it became beautiful) a song came on which i do not remember if it was actually sw or i was dreaming another song, but the point is i went behind the dj's table and realized that chris hall was actually singing the song. so i screamed something along the lines " omg, that is chris hall" and then the whole floor cleared(i do not know why) and him and i started talking and it was amazing because despite it's lack of reality i actually felt like someone cared/wanted to know me. and when he had to leave we hugged for what seemed like hours and then he left. well, then i went back to my "position" on the boat and all of the kids that i was supposed to be watching mutinied and told the instructor. and so i was fired and literally thrown off the ship, but i never cared. 
and then i woke up...

while that dream was one of the more normal/less interesting dreams i have had it is always better to remember the good ones than dwell on the others.

happy birthday jay gordon, because i know you are reading this! on a much more depressing/ridiculous note, colin farrel and britney spears? psha. i cant believe he is cheating on me with her, come on fbw! anyway, i am tired its way past my bed time and i have a test for dunnn which i will not/cannot study for because alas i left my book at school to alleviate any discomfort i would feel on my walk from school to katrina's house, but coincidentally this happened to be the only night i actually needed my book. good job... zzzzzzzzzz necessito dormir ahora porque si no puedo levantar en la manana yo voy a matar mi computadora para mantenerme despierto toda la noche. in other words... byyyyyyyye
